SSHS Summer Program 2024 at Maple Avenue Middle School

Co-Principals: Erin Bennett & Stacey Ralston: (518) 587- 6690 ext. 33341

All required courses for graduation will be in-person using a computer-based credit recovery program.

Class Schedule:

Classes are in session, in-person from Monday, July 15th through Tuesday, August 13th. All classes are scheduled Monday through Thursday from 8:00 a.m.—11:00 a.m. Students are expected to be in attendance each day for teacher support during this time. *Students will earn a grade of 65 for successful completion of course requirements.

Dates to Remember:

  • Monday, July 1 – Friday, July 5: Online Registration 
  • Monday, July 15: First day of in-person summer program classes
  • Thursday, July 18: Last Day to Register for a Regents Exam
  • Tuesday, August 13:  Last Day of Classes
  • Thursday, August 15 at 11:30 a.m.: Earth Science Practical 
  • Wednesday, August 14 & Thursday, August 15: Regents Exam Review

Regents Review Sessions at Maple Avenue:

  • Wednesday, August 14 from 8 a.m. – 11 a.m.
    • Algebra I – F181
    • English Language Arts – F182
    • Physical Setting Earth Science – F187
  • Wednesday, August 14 from 12 p.m. – 3 p.m.
    • Global History & Geography II –  F181
    • Living Environment –  F185
  • Thursday, August 15 from 8:00 a.m. – 11:00 a.m.
    • Algebra I – F181
    • English Language Arts –  F182
    • Physical Setting Earth Science – F187
  • Thursday, August 15 from 12 p.m. – 3 p.m.
    • US History – F181
    • Living Environment = F185

Regents Exam Schedule at Maple Avenue:

  • Thursday, August 15 at 11:30
    • Earth Science Lab Practical 
  • Monday, August 19 at 8 a.m. 
    • Algebra I
    • English Language Arts
  • Monday, August 19 at 12 p.m.
    • Global History & Geography II
    • Algebra II
  • Tuesday, August 20 at 8 a.m. 
    • US History & Government
    • Physical Setting/Earth Science
    • Physical Setting/Chemistry
  • Tuesday, August 20 at 12 p.m.
    • Geometry
    • Living Environment

Attendance:

Students are allowed no more than (3) days of excused absences for circumstances such as illness or emergencies. Students who are absent in excess of (3) days will not be able to fulfill participation and academic requirements for the course.

Transportation:

Transportation will be provided to and from Maple Avenue Middle School. Parents will notify their child’s high school counselor if transportation is needed.

Registration Procedures:

Parents will be mailed a notification if it is recommended that their child attend summer program by their high school counselor. School counselors will be available by phone to answer questions and assist with online registration. Online registration will be open and available July 1st – July 5th using the summer program online registration form.

Student Conduct:

Students are expected to be engaged, prepared to work and cooperate fully with their teachers each day. Acts of insubordination towards any staff member, disrespect towards other students or any behavior disruptive to the educational process may result in dismissal from the summer program.

Final Report Cards will be mailed home approximately one week after the summer program ends.
